page.title: 17KILMINGTON AND SHUTE WOODS
page.content: The woods are made up mainly of coniferous trees, but there are deciduous trees growing around the outer edges. Shute Wood is larger than Kilmington Wood, and is all around Shute Hill. Kilmington Wood grows on the hill near the Roman road. There are paths through both the woods and there is quite a lot of wildlife, so it is a nice place for naturalists to visit. Perhaps the greatest attraction is in the autumn, when it is a popular place for collecting conkers and chestnuts, as there are both horse chestnut trees and sweet chestnut trees.
